entities.name: goblins
entities.description: The goblins are described as watching Harry and Bagman in silence through their dark, slanting eyes. They are also mentioned to be speaking in a language called Gobbledegook.

entities.name: bagma n
entities.description: Bagman is described as noticing Harry watching the goblins and making a comment about their English not being good. He also mentions that he knows one word of Gobbledegook, which means 'pickax'.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is described as watching the goblins and noticing how they are still watching Bagman very closely. He also asks Bagman what the goblins want.

entities.name: barry crouch
entities.description: Barry Crouch is mentioned by Bagman as being the person that the goblins are looking for.

entities.name: quidditch world cup
entities.description: The Quid-ditch World Cup is mentioned by Bagman as a comparison to the current situation with the goblins.

entities.name: ministry in london
entities.description: The Ministry in London is mentioned by Harry as being where Barry Crouch is currently located.

relationships.description: The goblins are watching Bagman very closely, as described in the text: 'how the goblins were still watching Bagman very closely'.
Bagman is speaking to the goblins, as described in the text: 'said Bagman, noticing Harry watching the goblins too.'
Harry is asking Bagman what the goblins want, as described in the text: '“What do they want?” Harry said, noticing how the goblins were still watching Bagman very closely.'
The goblins are looking for Barry Crouch, as described in the text: 'They . . . er . . . they’re looking for Barry Crouch.'
